intro: Drymophloeus beguinii, commonly known as the African blackwood, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its hard, durable wood, it has been historically valued for furniture and carving.
